svcsubproc.title: Stationary Glass Removal
svcsubproc.para: Stationary glass removal are those panels that are mounted in an "H" type seal in the emergency exit door, the wheel chair lift access door and the passenger side entry doors.

There are many variations of window and glass arrangements installed school bus applications. However, the installation and maintenance procedures given in this section can be used as general information that is contingent on state specifications (optional equipment).

If the glass is broken it may have already fallen or been removed from the rubber gasket or seal. It is often necessary to remove cracked or otherwise imperfect glass that is still intact. In this case, it is a good practice to criss-cross the glass with strips of masking tape before removal. This will help hold glass together and minimize the risk of injury.
Follow the procedure as listed below for glass removal.

step1.para: Remove the lace rubber from the rubber gasket by prying out the edge of the lace rubber from the groove and continue to pull out the rubber.
For easy removal, insert a putty knife between the rubber gasket and the glass to break the sealant seal, making sure the glass is not stuck.
Repeat step two on the opposite side of glass.
Position an assistant outside the vehicle at the glass.
From inside the bus, push the glass from the rubber seal.
Have the assistant remove the glass and discard.
Remove the gasket from the window flange.
If the gasket is cut or damaged, discard and replace with new gasket.
